characters: ANOTHER PART OF LONDON, AT STREET LEVEL
TV FOOTAGE OF MCQUEEN CHASING MATER
THE ROCKET AND MISSILE COLLIDE IN MID-AIR, EXPLODE.
OF LIGHTNING MCQUEEN AND SIR TOW MATER."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TINY CRAB BOAT (CRABBY) crests over massive swells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright buddy, we're here. Right where you paid me to bring you. Question is, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A metallic blue sports car, circa the `60s, emerges from 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shadows. Cagey, smooth, he'd turn heads driving through a intersection in the world. Meet FINN MCMISSILE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car? Hey pal, you can't get any further away from land than out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly where I want to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I got news for you, buddy. There's nobody out here but us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a HORN -- a COMBAT SHIP, the size of most cruis ships. FINN quickly backs into the shadows, out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it look like, genius? I'm crabbing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well turn around and go back where you came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? And who's gonna make me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A laser sight hits Crabby between the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright! Don't get your prop in a twist. (as he turns to leave) What a jerk. Sorry, buddy. Looks like it's the end of the line. Buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON CRABBY'S DECK: Finn is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FINN - He HANGS off the side of COMBAT SHIP, clandestine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're with Finn as the ship continues on, cuts through th darkness with purpose. Suddenly small flames appear, perh a knot or so away. Then WHOOSH!!! A flame rises above Fin the ship. It illuminates an OIL DERRICK. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THWAP! Finn fires a GRAPPLING HOOK to the derrick and SWI toward it. He's going to SLAM into the side with brute fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- HIS TIRES sprout a magnetic exoskeleton. He STICKS to derrick and now DRIVES VERTICALLY UP UP UP...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From this vantage point, hundreds of derricks appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn approaches a loading bay from above, hides. He watch as GREMLINS, PACERS and assorted other cars scurry about.

dialogues.speaker: FINN, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Leland Turbo, this is Finn McMissile. I'm at the rally point. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: FINN, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Leland, it's Finn. Please respond. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ACCESS DOOR OPENS LOUDLY below. A boxy, monacle-wearin German car enters. This is PROFESSOR OTTO ZUNDAPP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in German and English) Too many cars here. Out of my way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Zundapp?

dialogues.speaker: PACER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Here it is, Professor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zundapp approaches a NOSY PACER who idles next to a CRATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to see this before we load it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yes. Very carefully...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A forklift opens the crate -- inside is a TV CAMERA, pack carefully in foam. Finn SNAPS PHOTOS FURIOUSLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. A TV camera. What does it actually do? 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This camera is extremely dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you up to now, Professor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn, angling for a better view, FIRES SUSPENSION WIRES -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- which sail clear to the other side of the derrick ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- THOK! They hook tightly onto a steel girder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn slides out ONTO THE WIRE like an acrobat, then expel another cross-wire for support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is valuable equipment. Make sure it is properly secured for the voyage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn LOWERS HIMSELF. He snaps more pictures.

dialogues.speaker: GREM, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, Professor Z!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zundapp turns as a CRANE LOWERS A CAR-SIZED CRATE. GREM a ACER, an orange Gremlin and a green Pacer, flank it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is one of those British spies we told you about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. This one we caught sticking his bumper where it didn't belong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn PRODUCES SEMI-AUTOMATIC GUNS from his side, readies himself for a tag-team spy fight with his buddy Leland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Leland Turbo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crate is lifted, revealing a CRUSHED, CUBED Leland Tu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn's eyes go wide. Suddenly --- WHOOOSHHH! Another derr flame rises behind him, casts a Finn-shaped SHADOW over t Professor. He looks up. 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Finn McMissile! He's seen the camera! Kill him!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn UNLOADS with bullets as he starts to retreat --- He

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD GUY CARS are waiting for him on the catwalk where he came from - BLOWTORCHES ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn, stuck in midair, notices an angry CRANE. Finn GRINS having just found his escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THWAPTHWAPTHWAP!!! Finn releases three of his four cables swinging, Indiana Jones-style on the last one TOWARD THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- where he lands on its BOOM, drives UP and LAUNCHES OF where he LANDS - MOVING - onto another deck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn now DRIVES, spraying oil and screeching around corne A GREMLIN in pursuit hits the oil patch, loses control --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- and PLUMMETS OFF the side of the rig!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gremlin FALLS... it's like an eternity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smashes into the water and breaks into a million piece

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON FINN - Now set upon by 20 or 30 MORE pursuing cars. He nowhere to go but UP UP UP a ramp toward the helipad. He spies some GASOLINE BARRELS, fires a SINGLE BULLET which through its leather straps, sending barrels DOWN the ramp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- PAST the pursuing CARS ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- to the bottom where they EXPLODE in a CHAIN REACTION UP THE RAMP, taking out at least 15 CARS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE HELIPAD - Finn blasts into view, pulls to a stop. more road. Nowhere else to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 20 BAD GUY CARS that are still in pursuit surround hi fire up their blowtorches. About to pounce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn GRINS. The second time we've seen this grin. It mean he's got something cooking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn's REVERSE LIGHTS appear. He DRIVES BACKWARD off the of the helipad to the SHOCK of the other cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn falls. He turns himself so he's grill first, cleanly cutting into the water. 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He EMERGES, now sprouting HYDROFOIL and speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to the boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOATS - an army of combat ships quickly DROP into the and CHURN WATER with unprecedented fury as they quickly m up the distance between them and Finn, FIRING BULLETS as do so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's getting away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LEAD COMBAT SHIP quietly drops a TORPEDO into the wat It skips along, connecting with Finn in his rear and EXPLODING with such force that water skyrockets into the night clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDERWATER - McMissile SINKS. Then, he blinks. He GRINS. We're starting to like this grin and what follows it. He CONVERTS into a submarine. From his trunk he releases fou DECOY tires which float to the surface like body parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE DERRICK - Professor Zundapp watches it all from fa away.

dialogues.speaker: GREM, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: He's dead, Professor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wunderbar. With Finn McMissile gone, who can stop us now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOW MATER, a rusty tow truck, putters into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater. Tow Mater, that's who... is here to help you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches a broken-down sedan on the side of the road drives around to the front, catching OTIS' face for the f time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Otis! 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mater. Gosh, I'm so sorry. I thought I could make it this time, but... (he tries to start his engine, stalls) Smooth like pudding, huh? Ah, who am I kidding? I'll always be a lemon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater hooks his friend and starts towing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well dadgum, you're leaking oil again. Must be your gaskets. Hey, look on the bright side: This is your tenth tow this month, so that means it's on the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the only one that's nice to lemons like me, Mater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sweat it. These things happen to everybody, Otis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you never leak oil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I ain't perfect. Don't tell nobody, but I think my rust is starting to show through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater and Otis drive past THE RADIATOR SPRINGS WELCOME SI It has been amended to say: "Home of Lightning McQueen."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, is Lightning McQueen back yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must be crazy-excited about winning his fourth Piston Cup. Four! Wow! 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're so dadgum proud of him. But I sure wish he'd hurry up and get back `cause we got a whole summer's worth of best friend fun to make up for. Just me and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead of them, a half-mile off, a RED RACE CAR is visible

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- McQueen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater FLOORS IT, dragging poor Otis behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Mater? I'm in no hurry. You don't need to go so fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boom! They hit a bump. Otis catches air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightning McQueen is surrounded by his hometown friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Lightning. Welcome home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to have you back, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place wasn't the same without you, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Did he go somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to be home, everybody.

dialogues.speaker: MATER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: McQueen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all turn around, see Mater speeding into town, with swerving behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater! 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater skids into main street and in one swift motion, slingshots Otis forward ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woaahhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- right through Ramone's front door ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- where he lands perfectly on the hydraulic lift. Ramon lifts him up, routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. How far'd you make it this time, Otis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halfway to the county line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I can't believe it either!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen, welcome back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, it's so good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater and McQueen do an ELABORATE TIRE BUMP (fist bump style).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man. You ain't gonna believe the things I got planned for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone watches as the tire bump continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lizzie, an aside) These best friend greetings get longer every year. 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready to have some serious fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, actually I've got something to show you first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE PISTON CUP. It has now changed, been adorned with a small likeness of Doc. It says "Hudson Hornet Pist Cup."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. I can't believe they renamed the Piston Cup after our very own Doc Hudson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen and Mater are alone, the museum closed to the pub McQueen approaches a "Hudson Hornet" wall with Doc's thre Piston cups, framed articles, other racing ephemera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Doc said these things were just old cups, but to have someone else win it just didn't feel right, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Doc would've been real proud of you. That's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen and Mater exit the Doc Hudson Museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, pal. I've been waiting all summer for this. What've you got planned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you can handle it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you know who you're talking to? This is Lightning McQueen. I can handle anything. 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater and McQueen roll on an old train track, their tires off. They're on their rims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh.... Mater?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just remember, your brakes ain't gonna work on these!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they head INTO A DARK TUNNEL ---

dialogues.speaker: MCQUEEN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Mater!

dialogues.speaker: MATER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Relax, these train tracks ain't been used in years!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From inside the tunnel a loud TRAIN HORN. The two friends emerge, going as fast as they can on train tracks, uphill with no tires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on! Faster, faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later a harmless GALLOPING GOOSE appears, oversiz horn visible, cackling and laughing at his prank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ENORMOUS EARTH MOVER sleeps. McQueen and Mater sneak u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is gonna be good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They blow their horns and he TIPS OVER, tractor-tipping style. They LAUGH at the gag, but soon realize the earth mover's GIANT EXHAUST PIPE is directly above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. This ain't gonna be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The exhaust pipe BELCHES. McQueen and Mater are BLASTED o of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun sets. McQueen and Mater roll into town. McQueen l exhausted. Mater is still full of energy. 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, this was the best day ever! And my favorite souvenir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater proudly shows off a dent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This new dent!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, Mater. Today was, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot, that was nothing. Wait til you see what I got planned for tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, Mater. Whoa. I was kind of thinking of just a quiet dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's exactly what I was thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I... I meant with Sally, Mater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even better! You, me and Miss Sally going out for supper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen pulls around in front of Mater, stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, I meant it would be just me and Sally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just for tonight. We'll do whatever you want tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. Y'all go on and have fun now. 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, then. See ya soon, amigo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen drives off. Mater watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been converted into a white-tablecloth restaurant, w cars dining al fresco and a hopping gastropub inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MCQUEEN AND SALLY have a prime table with a view of Radia Springs and the starry night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you how good it is to be here alone. Just the two of us. Finally, you and me ---

dialogues.speaker: MATER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater is at their table, dressed as a waiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Mater and I'll be your waiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater the waiter. That's funny right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, you work here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well yeah I work here. What'd you think, I just snuck in here when nobody was looking and pretended to be your waiter, just so I could hang out with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen and Sally exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. How ridiculous would that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, can I start you two lovebirds off with a couple drinks? 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'll have my usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? I'm going to have that too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, right. Your usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE AT THE BAR - Fillmore and Sarge watch as Guido mix drinks, ala "Cocktail." Mater arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guido! What's McQueen's usual?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Italian, subtitled) How should I know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect! Give me two of `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet! My program's on.

dialogues.speaker: MEL DORADO, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Tonight on "The Mel Dorado Show"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE BAR TV - "THE MEL DORADO SHOW," a cable talk show, begins with file footage of MILES AXLEROD, a sleek SUV.

dialogues.speaker: MEL DORADO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: His story gripped the world! Oil billionaire Miles Axlerod, in an attempt to become the first car to circumnavigate the globe without GPS, ironically ran out of gas and found himself trapped in the wild!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see images of newspaper headlines, search crews.

dialogues.speaker: MEL DORADO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Feared dead, he emerged 36 days later, running on a fuel he'd distilled himself from the natural elements! Since then he's sold his oil fortune, converted himself from a gas-guzzler into an electric car, and has devoted his life to finding a renewable, clean-burning fuel! 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Images of oil derricks torn down; Miles Axlerod getting converted to electric; lab scientists testing chemicals.

dialogues.speaker: MEL DORADO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Now he claims to have done it with his Allinol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Images of fields, rivers, vegetables, and mountains all combining to form the Allinol logo.

dialogues.speaker: MEL DORADO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: And to show the world what his new superfuel can do, he's created a racing competition like no other, inviting the greatest champions from around the globe to battle in the first ever World Grand Prix. Welcome Sir Miles Axlerod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIR MILES AXLEROD arrives, parks across from Mel's desk.

dialogues.speaker: MILES AXLEROD, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mel. It is very good to be here. Now listen to me: Big Oil. It costs a fortune. Pollution is getting worse. I mean, come on. It's a fossil fuel. Fossil. As in dead dinosaurs. And we all know what happened to them. Alternative energy is the future. Trust me, Mel, after seeing Allinol in action at the World Grand Prix, nobody will ever go back to gasoline again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to the dinosaurs, now?

dialogues.speaker: MEL DORADO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: And on satellite, a World Grand Prix competitor and one of the fastest cars in the world, Francesco Bernoulli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the screen: LIVE FROM ROME, ITALY. We meet Formula race car FRANCESCO BERNOULLI.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: It is an honor, Signore Dorado. For you. 16.

dialogues.speaker: MEL DORADO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Miles, why not invite Lightning McQueen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, collecting his drinks, looks up, half-intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: MILES AXLEROD, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Of course we invited him. But apparently after a very long racing season he is taking some time off to rest.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Lightning McQueen would not have a chance against Francesco!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater doesn't like this.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: I can go over 300 kilometers an hour! In miles that is like, uh... way faster than McQueen.

dialogues.speaker: MEL DORADO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Let's go to the phones. Baltimore, Maryland, you're on the air.

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Am I on? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: MEL DORADO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: You're on. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: MEL DORADO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Go ahead, caller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dial tone.

dialogues.speaker: MEL DORADO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Let's go to Radiator Springs. You're on, caller.

dialogues.speaker: MATER'S VOICE, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Yeah, that Italian feller you got on there can't talk that way about Lightning McQueen. He's the bestest race car in the whole wide world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fillmore and Sarge look around. Mater is visible in the b of the bar on an office phone. 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh...

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: If he is, how you say "the bestest race car," then why must he rest, eh?

dialogues.speaker: MATER'S VOICE, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Cause he knows what's important. Every now and then he prefers just to slow down, enjoy life.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Ah, you heard it! Lightning McQueen prefers to be slow! Of course, this is not news to Francesco. When I want to go to sleep I watch one of his races. After two laps I am out cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audible RXNS from the bar. A crowd has been forming ever since Mater started talking.

dialogues.speaker: MATER'S VOICE, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: That ain't what I meant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MCQUEEN AND SALLY - They hear the commotion inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's going on over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAR - Sally and McQueen push through the crowd, see t they're watching Francesco on the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's that Italian Formula car. His name is ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francesco Bernoulli. No wonder there's a crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Sally says his name, she enunciates each part, as if Italian were her mother's tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, why do you know his name? And don't say it like that. It's three syllables, not ten. 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He's nice to look at. You know, open-wheeled and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with fenders? I thought you like my fenders.

dialogues.speaker: MATER'S VOICE, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Well let me tell you something else there, Mr. San Francisco ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater?

dialogues.speaker: MATER'S VOICE, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: McQueen could drive circles around you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Driving in circles is all he can do, no?

dialogues.speaker: MATER'S VOICE, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: No! I mean yes. I mean he could beat you anywhere, anytime, any track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On McQueen - he looks at Guido who gives a nod over to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- Mater, turned away from the crowd, still on the phone

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Mel, can we move on? Francesco needs a caller who can provide a little more intellectual stimulation. Like a dump truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MCQUEEN. He doesn't like this at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha! That shows what you know. Dump trucks is dumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Mater is YANKED from the booth and replaced by McQueen.

dialogues.speaker: MCQUEEN, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yeah, hi, this is Lightning McQueen. Look, I don't appreciate my best friend being insulted like that. 19.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: McQueen! That was your best friend? This is the difference between you and Francesco. Francesco knows how good he is. He does not need to surround himself with tow trucks to prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are strong words from a car that is so fragile.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: FragilГ©!? He calls Francesco fragilГ©? Not so fast, McQueen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Not so fast." What is that, your new motto?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francesco goes ballistic in Italian. They cut his mic.

dialogues.speaker: MILES AXLEROD, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Well, this sounds like something that needs to be settled on the race course. What do you say, Lightning McQueen? We've still got room for one more racer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I would love to. The only thing is my crew's off for the season so ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sound O.S. McQueen turns to see Fillmore, Sarge and Lui flank a tablecloth which is hanging off the bar. Ramone b away, having spray painted "TEAM LIGHTNING MCQUEEN" on it Guido quickly uncorks three wine bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pit stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen turns back to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? They just got back. Deal me in, baby. Ka-chow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place ERUPTS IN CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOMENTS LATER - General excitement as McQueen exits the p booth where Sally waits. Off her look: 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know. I just got back. But we won't be long and ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, don't worry about me. I've got enough to do here. Mater's going to have a blast though. (off McQueen's silence) You're bringing Mater, right? You never bring him to any of your races.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen turns to the bar where Mater privately tries thei drinks, hates it, spits it back in the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let him sit in the pits, give him a headset. C'mon, it'll be a thrill of a lifetime for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your drinks, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't taste it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you like to come and see the world with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me into this thing. You're coming along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - McQueen is given a new paint job and headlights by Ramo Mater, now sporting a "Team McQueen" emblem, seems psyche well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - An airport DEPARTURES SIGN advertises the next flight: Tokyo, Japan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Mater waves goodbye with his hook alongside McQueen, Gu Luigi, Fillmore and Sarge as --- 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- the rest of Radiator Springs watches them board a pla Red bawls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - IN THE JET, LATER. McQueen and Mater are the only ones awake, watch an insane Japanese game show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - JAPAN AT NIGHT. A stylish Tokyo cityscape of neon, glam scrolling billboards, vending machines and high-tech skyscrapers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - INSIDE A SOUVENIR SHOP loaded with McQueen toys: Mater McQueen enter. A tourist sees McQueen and faints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - A KABUKI THEATER. Team McQueen watches a methodical dan Mater, dressed in Kabuki makeup, arrives. He looks insane

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - A SUMO MATCH - Two SUZUKI SAMURAI CARS wrestle over a parking space. Mater, now in his element, cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MONTAGE ENDS on this high note as we CUT TO ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ---- TEAM MCQUEEN, as they roll up the red carpet. Press held at bay behind ropes. WORLD GRAND PRIX and ALLINOL lo are strategically placed for maximum press exposure. RACE are interviewed by press behind the red-carpet ropes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Team McQueen enters via a second floor landing which overlooks a massive indoor party in a converted museum. A they roll down a ramp to the party, they are awed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guido, look! Ferraris and tires! Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look at this. Okay now Mater, remember: best behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it, buddy. Hey, what's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees something, peels away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, McQueen, over here! 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fellow racers JEFF GORVETTE and LEWIS HAMILTON. McQu now has no choice but to let Mater go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jeff. Lewis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATER as he approaches a GLASS-ENCLOSED ROCK GARDEN where pitty RAKES rocks with precision. He knocks on the glass his hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! You done good! You got all the leaves!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People turn at the noise he's making.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MCQUEEN, JEFF and LEWIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check out that tow truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder who that guy's with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you guys excuse me just for one little second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He zips over to Mater's side, quickly pulls him out of si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, listen. This isn't Radiator Springs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just realizing that? Boy, that jet-lag really done a number on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, look -- things are different over here. Which means maybe you should, you know, act a little different too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different than what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, just... help me out here, buddy. I --- 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need help? Shoot, why didn't you just say so? That's what a tow truck does. Hey, looky there, it's Mr. San Francisco!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANCESCO is visible across the room, holding court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll introduce you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (already on his way) Look at me -- I'm helping you already!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On FRANCESCO - MOMENTS LATER. Mater approaches, giddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Mr. San Francisco, I'd like you to meet ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightning McQueen! Buona sera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Francesco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, nice to meet you too. You are very good-looking. Not as good as I thought, but you're good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Can I get a picture with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything for McQueen's friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mater poses for a photo with Francesco:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Sally is gonna flip when she sees this. She's Lightning McQueen's girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a big fan of yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, she has good taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater's prone to exaggeration. I wouldn't say she's a "big" fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. She's a huge fan. She goes on and on about your open wheels here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mentioning it once doesn't qualify as going "on and on."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francesco is familiar with this reaction to Francesco. Women respect a car that has nothing to hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us have a toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen doesn't like where this is going, covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising a drink) I dedicate my win tomorrow... to Miss Sally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. I already dedicated MY win tomorrow to her. So if we both do it, it's really not so special. Besides, I don't have a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go get you one. You mind if I borrow a few bucks for one of them drinks? 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (could kill him) They're free, Mater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free? Well, shoot, what am I doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater ZIPS OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should probably go keep an eye on him. See you at the race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you will see Francesco. But not like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francesco does a 180, so his rear end now faces McQueen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will see him like this, as he drives away from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francesco wears a bumper sticker that says "Ciao, McQueen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cute. So you had one of those made up for all the racers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rolls off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is so getting beat tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights caress the main stage where a crowd has formed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlecars... Sir Miles Axlerod!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILES AXLEROD drives through an infinity fountain, appear 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is my absolute honor to introduce to you the competitors in the first-ever World Grand Prix. From Brazil. Number eight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON FINN MCMISSILE. He appears from the shadows, keeps a careful distance from the stage. He ZEROES HIS GAZE ON --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- THE WORLD GRAND PRIX TV CAMERAS which roll, catching Miles Axlerod's speech for publicity and posterity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn's ONBOARD COMPUTER ANALYZES each one, compares to th photos we saw him snap on the oil platform. Each one is " A MATCH." His view is suddenly disrupted by A BEAUTIFUL SPORTS CAR. She approaches Finn. Meet HOLLEY SHIFTWELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Volkswagen Karmann Ghia has no radiator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because it's air-cooled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Agent Shiftwell, Holley Shiftwell from the Tokyo Station. I have a message from London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must try the canapes on the mezzanine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves her onto an elevator. The doors close on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the lab boys analyzed the photo I sent? What did they learn about the camera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears to be a standard television camera. They said if you could get closer photos next time, that would be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was London's message? 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- no, no. No sir. Um, the oil platforms you were on? Turns out they're sitting on the biggest oil reserve in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did we miss that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'd been scrambling everyone's satellites. The Americans actually discovered it just before you did. They placed an agent on that platform, under deep cover. He was able to get a photo of the car who's running the entire operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors OPEN and they exit onto the Mezzanine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it? Has anyone seen the photo yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not yet. The American is here tonight to pass it to you. He'll signal you when he's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn suddenly STOPS COLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Zundapp is visible below them. He talks with a Pacers and Gremlins. Finn quickly retreats into the shado Holley follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Change of plan. You're meeting the American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, me? 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those thugs down there were on the oil platform. If they see me, the whole mission is compromised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. I'm technical, you see. I'm in Diagnostics. I'm not a field agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATER as he grabs a drink, keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snatches it, drops it in the back where we now see a l assortment of drinks balanced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never know which one McQueen'll have a hankering for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches a sushi bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what you got here that's free? How about that pistachio ice cream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He refers to wasabi, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. Wasabi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, same ol', same ol'. What's up with you? That looks delicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chef starts to carve a small scoop aside for Mater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, a little more, please. It is free, right? (the chef adds more) Keep it coming. A little more. Come on, let's go, it's free! You're getting there... Scoop scoop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chef gives in. Scoops a baseball-sized ball out. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go. Now THAT's a scoop of ice cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese, subtitles) My condolences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILES AXLEROD - He's now nearly done with his intros.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and now, our last competitor --- Number 95, Lightning McQueen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MCQUEEN approaches the microphone, flashes his headlights

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much for having us, Sir Axlerod. I really look forward to racing. This is a great opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the pleasure is all ours, Lightning. You and your team bring excellence and professionalism to this competition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if on cue, Mater arrives with a piercing scream of pai Everyone turns as he charges head first toward the stage, making a bee-line for that FOUNTAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody get me water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laps up water from the fountain like a diabetic cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet relief...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles Axlerod is shocked. The crowd can't believe it. Francesco cackles. Mater, now sated, approaches the mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the crowd) Whatever you do, do not eat the free pistachio ice cream. It has turned!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Axlerod, I can explain. This is Mater. 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know him. This is the bloke that called into the television show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one I have to thank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you. This trip's been amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a little excited, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TILT DOWN to reveal a pool of oil beneath Mater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But wait, I... oh, shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen quickly pulls Mater aside, out of earshot of Mile Axlerod and the others. McQueen is beside himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, you have to get a hold of yourself. You're making a scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I never leak oil. Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go take care of yourself right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drives through the party, frantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming through! Excuse me, leakin' oil. Where's the bathroom? Thank you. I gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone points Mater down a hallway. He whips around the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- and STOPS. Finds himself in front of TWO BATHROOM DOO neither of which clearly indicate MALE or FEMALE. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater chooses one, drives inside. A SHRIEK is heard and M zips out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry ladies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads into the other door ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater rolls in, still `holding it in' like a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never leak I never leak I never leak...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees someone leaving a stall. He heads in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE STALL - Mater enters, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wowee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stall is a complicated apparatus with buttons and lig High-tech Japanese. It suddenly GRABS MATER, hoists him u if he's going to get an oil change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in the---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Japanese style cartoon CARICATURE appears on a TV MONIT followed by images of waterfalls and rivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that tickles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caricature starts talking in Japanese. Suddenly WATER FIRES UP underneath Mater's undercarriage, goosing him. H freaks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUTSIDE THE STALL - With Mater's yells audible we see a GREMLIN enter, furtive. Suddenly, inexplicably, his frame BREAKS APART like an egg, revealing an AMERICAN MUSCLE CA underneath. The pieces of the Gremlin disappear under him clearly his disguise. This is ROD REDLINE - American Agen 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, McMissile. I'm here. It's time for the drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLLEY, rolls along by herself. Nervous. DING! Her rearvi monitor springs to life.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLEY, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: The American has activated his tracking beacon.

dialogues.speaker: FINN, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Roger that. Move in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rod Redline, waiting at a sink, feels a presence behind h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREM and ACER have entered, hesitate briefly when they se Rod Redline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rod Redline, careful, slides a gun out of his tire. He is suddenly CHARGED by the AMCs --- Rod SPINS AROUND and get shot off but is SLAMMED HEAD FIRST. A TIGHT, CLOSE-QUARTE FIGHT begins ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE STALL - Mater, still TRAPPED, is now being SCRUBBE if in a car wash. He is helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUTSIDE THE STALL - Rod is being pulverized. Just when he scrambles away from one car, the other one takes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE STALL - Mater is mercifully released, but when he backs out ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- Rod Redline is THROWN INTO MATER'S STALL DOOR, crunch it and sending Mater ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- BACK INTO THE CLUTCHES of the insane toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley isolates the tracking beacon's location in the par

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you've got to be joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem, Shiftwell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in the loo. 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So go in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't just go into the men's loo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time is of the essence, Shiftwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rod Redline is in bad shape. He backs away, betrays a loo concern. He's in trouble here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACER burns rubber, ready to finish him off. Just as he sh into DRIVE ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- MATER'S STALL DOOR KICKS OPEN, knocking ACER out. Mat jumps out, face-to-face GREM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath) Whatever you do, I would not go in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door SWINGS shut, revealing the pulverized Acer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Gremlin and a Pacer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rod Redline, now behind Mater and sensing an opportunity here, quickly produces A SMALL DEVICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Grem and Acer) No offense to your makes and models, but you guys break down harder than my cousin Betsy after she got left at the ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rod Redline, surreptitiously attaches the device to Mater undercarriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he's goosed) --- altar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spins around, sees Rod Redline for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Tow truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater turns back to Grem and Acer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd like to get to our private business here, if you don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Don't let me get in the way of your "private business." Oh! A little advice: When you hear her giggle and see that waterfall, you best press that green button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's to adjust the temperature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember it's in Celsius, not Fahrenheit.

dialogues.speaker: GREM AND ACER
dialogues.text: Get outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater exits, leaving Rod Redline to a now even angrier Gr and Acer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley arrives at the door. She takes a breath, is about enter when Mater EXITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes her, expelling some exhaust in the process. Holley's rearview tracking confirms that the device is on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dadgum pistachio ice cream. 35.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLEY, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: This cannot be him.

dialogues.speaker: FINN, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Is he American?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (driving off, to himself) Look out, ladies. Mater's fittin' to get funky!

dialogues.speaker: HOLLEY, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Extremely.

dialogues.speaker: FINN, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Then it's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's settled. Holley takes one more nervous breath, quick closes the distance between her and Mater, cuts him off. is forced to STOP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Volkswagen Karmann Ghia has no radiator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well of course it doesn't. That's `cause it's air-cooled!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. I'm from the Tokyo Station

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course, Karmann Ghia's weren't the only ones. Besides the Beetles you had your Type-3 Squarebacks, with the pancake motors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay, I get it---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And before both of them, there's the Type-2 buses - my buddy Fillmore's one of them. 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen! We should find somewhere more private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, gee. Don't you think that's a little, uh ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. Impossible to know which areas here are compromised. So, when can I see you again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's see. Tomorrow I'll be out there at the races.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it. We'll rendezvous then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater returns to his team, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are. Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a rendezvous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A date?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what's going on is I've got me a date tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guido makes a crack in Italian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guido don't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, believe it. My new girlfriend just said so. Hey, there she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater points out Holley, who's within earshot. 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey lady!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley, caught in plain view, DRIVES OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya tomorrow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guido makes another crack in Italian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guido still don't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An industrial dock, outside of the city proper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rod Redline dangles from a car magnet. He's been beaten u clings to consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: GREM, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I gotta admit ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grem, Acer, and a bunch of nasty looking troublemakers lo up at Rod amidst crates and shipping containers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- you tricked us real good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we don't like being tricked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rod Redline laughs to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's so funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know, I was just wearing a disguise. You guys are stuck looking like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't help him. They DROP HIM onto a TREADMILL, lo him down. A container is wheeled forward and Rod is plied with Allinol brand gasoline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allinol? Thanks, fellas. I hear this stuff is good for you. 38.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR ZUNDAPP, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: So you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Professor emerges from the darkness, behind Rod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allinol by itself is good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zundapp hits a button and the TREADMILL starts Rod's whee spinning at a high rate of speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But after microscopic examination, I have found that it has one small weakness. When hit with an electromagnetic pulse, it becomes extremely dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grem pushes a World Grand Prix CAMERA - the same one that was in the box back at the oil derrick. He points it at R Redline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- for the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all you want? I got a whole act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were very interested in this camera on the oil platform. Now you will witness what it really does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, Professor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acer pushes a TV MONITOR toward Rod. On it, surveillance footage from the party. Clearly, they were watching and recording him there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talked up a lot of cars last night. Which one's your associate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother. Oh no, I'm sorry. It was your sister. You know, I can't tell them apart these days. 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I start it now, Professor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty percent power. (to Rod Redline) This camera is actually an electromagnetic pulse emitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: a girl on the TV) What about her? Did you give it to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Allinol is now heating to a boil, dramatically expanding, causing the engine block to crack under the stress, forcing oil into the combustion chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rod Redline's engine starts to CRACK and BREAK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: a guy on the TV) How about him? You talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Professor Zundapp) What do I care? I can replace an engine block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may be able to, but after full impact of the pulse, unfortunately, there will be nothing to replace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about him? Does he have it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monitor reveals MATER, rolling out of the bathroom an down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rod Redline, seeing this, does the world's most subtle do take. We caught it, but there's no way anyone else in the room could have ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him. He's the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that, Professor Z. 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Grem turns up the machine even MORE, the Professor mak call.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR ZUNDAPP, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yes sir. We believe the infiltrator has passed along sensitive information. (beat, listening) I will take care of it before any damage can be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Professor hangs up, turns to the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The project is still on schedule. You will find this second agent ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zundapp kicks the camera's power into the RED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- and kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the MONITOR - With Mater's frozen image on the screen see Rod EXPLODE in the reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over television pre-roll of Japan:

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Japan. Land of the rising sun. Where ancient tradition meets modern technology. Welcome to the inaugural running of the World Grand Prix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON OUR ANNOUNCERS as they introduce themselves:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Brent Mustangburger, here with racing legends Darrell Cartrip and David Hobbscap. There's never been a competition like this before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOTS OF THE PITS as the racers fuel up.

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: First, Allinol, making its debut tonight as the required fuel for all these great champions.

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Second, the course itself, and it's like nothing we've ever seen. David, how exactly does this competition work?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID HOBBSCAP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well, Brent, all three of these street courses are classic round- the-house racetracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUTLINES OF THREE RACE COURSES are shown. They're labeled Japan, Italy and England, and are different in shape and size.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID HOBBSCAP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This means that the LMP and Formula cars should break out of the gate in spectacular fashion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOTS OF THE RACERS as they weave up the track, practicin

dialogues.speaker: DAVID HOBBSCAP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Look for Francesco Bernoulli in particular to lead early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOTS OF Francesco, featured in an inset.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID HOBBSCAP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And with a series of technical turns throughout ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE SHOTS of the course, now highlighting the tech turns

dialogues.speaker: DAVID HOBBSCAP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: GT and Touring cars like Spain's Miguel Camino should make up some ground but I doubt it'll be enough to stop Francesco from absolutely running away with it.

dialogues.speaker: DARRELL CARTRIP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Woah, now just hold your horsepower. You're forgetting the most important factor here. That early dirt track section of the course! The dirt is supposed to be the great equalizer in this race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAPHICS OF THE COURSES now isolate a stretch after the f couple turns, label it "DIRT SECTIONS." 42.

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: French Rally car Raoul Г‡aRoule is counting on a big boost headed through there.

dialogues.speaker: DARRELL CARTRIP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And don't forget Lightning McQueen! His mentor, the Hudson Hornet, was one of the greatest dirt track racers of all time. In my opinion, McQueen is the best all-around racer in this competition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, Darrell, I think you need to clean your windshield. You're clearly not seeing this for what it is: Francesco's race to lose.

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's time to find out. The racers are locking into the grid ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engines rev as everyone gets ready to go. Everyone's brig eyed and alert except for McQueen who we find in the back the grid. He CLOSES his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed. I am speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LAUGH O.S. McQueen opens his eyes. Francesco is next to on the grid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? You are "speed"? Then Francesco is triple speed. (closes his eyes) Francesco. Is. Triple speed. Francesco likes this, McQueen. It's really getting him into the zone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is so getting beat today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The starting lights click down from RED to YELLOW to GREE The race begins. Francesco quickly grabs the lead. He's pulling away within seconds. 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON PIT ROW - We TRACK PAST as the various Crew Chiefs on their crash carts bark orders to their racers. We end on McQueen. No Crew Chief, just a solid looking team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His suspension stats look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tire pressure is excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got plenty of fuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's awesome!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same view of Mater but now THROUGH A TELESCOPIC DISPL Reveal Finn and Holley watching from high above in a down office building, behind reflective glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he in the pits? He's so exposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his cover. One of the best I've seen, too. Look at the detail on that rust. It must have cost him a fortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why hasn't he contacted us yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's probably heat on him. Be patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, of course. He'll signal us when he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we find out who's behind all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TRACK - VARIOUS SHOTS OF THE RACE through Tokyo as Francesco extends his lead and McQueen attempts to make u ground. 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN MCQUEEN'S PIT - Mater watches the monitors, sees them approaching the dirt section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen! It's time to make your move. Get on the outside and show 'em what Doc done taught you.

dialogues.speaker: MCQUEEN, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Ten four, Mater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TRACK - Francesco hits the dirt section and loses control. He SLAMS to a halt, his tires getting no tractio

dialogues.speaker: DAVID HOBBSCAP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Francesco is brought to a screeching halt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MCQUEEN skids into view, turning right to go left, passin Francesco, followed by other cars ---

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Lightning McQueen is the first to take advantage. And just like that, folks, Francesco's lead is left in the dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice call, Mater. Keep it up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen now leads the pack, zooming out of the dirt now starting to relax.

dialogues.speaker: DARRELL CARTRIP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Who-hoo! Man, McQueen looks happier than a rollbar at a demolition derby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The field of cars thunders into a tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Everyone's jostling for position as we hit the asphalt again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francesco crests the hill, in last place. He bites down, determined, then CHASES.

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Francesco lost a lot of momentum in the dirt. He's got some serious work ahead of him if he wants to get back in this race. 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS OF TOKYO as the racers move through the Rai Bridge. Bit by bit, Francesco ekes his way toward the fro toward Lightning McQueen as we CUT TO ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- A ROOFTOP, and a VIEW THROUGH THE WGP CAMERA LENS. Gr and Acer are manning this one. They focus it on the racer they approach.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR ZUNDAPP, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: It is time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TRACK - A racer (Miguel Camino) suddenly PLUMES WI SMOKE and skids out.

dialogues.speaker: DARRELL CARTRIP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh! Miguel Camino has blown an engine!

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Very unusual, Darrell. He's been so consistent all year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camino quickly pits, passing McQueen's pit where Mater is visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON GREM AND ACER, watching from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that tow truck from the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one from the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the one the American Agent passed the device to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him? He's in the pits! 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acer exits, with purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON FINN AND HOLLEY, still in their office hideaway. Holle onboard computer flashes an ALERT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. I think I've got something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pacer from the party last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's spotted Acer, moving swiftly forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross-referencing with the photos from the oil derricks... Yep. His VIN numbers match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone with him? He won't be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conducting analysis on the target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The computer finds more and more bad guy Pacers and Greml are in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not the only one here. Three... five... they're everywhere. And they're all closing in on... oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN OVER to see it's MATER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn? Finn, where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns. He's GONE, leaving only an open window.

dialogues.speaker: FINN, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Get him out of the pits now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN MCQUEEN'S PIT. A car WHIPS BY O.S. 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! Some of them fellers is really loud.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLEY, (OVER MATER'S RADIO)
dialogues.text: Can you hear me? Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, what?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLEY, (OVER MATER'S RADIO)
dialogues.text: Get out of the pit now. Do you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater realizes this girl has somehow broken into his radi

dialogues.speaker: MATER, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Hey, I know you. You're that girl from the party last night. You wanna do our date right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TRACK - McQueen boxes out Francesco, holds his sli lead, but barely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, a little too much chatter. Let's keep this line clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! A racer behind McQueen suddenly expels black smoke, skids out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON GREM - laughing. That was clearly his handiwork.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLEY, (ON MATER'S RADIO)
dialogues.text: There's no time for messing about. You've got to get out of the pits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there gonna be cable where you is so I can watch the rest of the race?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON HOLLEY - Watching from the downtown building.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLEY, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: You're running out of time!

dialogues.speaker: FINN, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: They're coming, Shiftwell.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLEY, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Yes, I know. 48.

dialogues.speaker: FINN, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Get him out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CUT BACK TO ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- MATER. He gives in, exits the pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, all right but I usually like to have a proper detailing done before I meet a lady friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves toward the back PIT DOOR, is about to open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUTSIDE THE PITS - ACER and another Pacer approach McQuee pit door on the other side. Ready to pounce. The doors OP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- Finn, holding a fire extinguisher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn McMissile? But you're dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then this shouldn't hurt at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He empties the extinguisher in their eyes, speeds past. T try and follow, but have been blinded. One of them crashe right into a COP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON FINN - Already on the move, along a side street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Shiftwell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON HOLLEY - Tracking everything on a grid map. Mater look like Pac Man, weaving through the streets as bad guys clo in all around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got him in the back alleys east of the garages. Multiple assailants are closing in quickly.

dialogues.speaker: FINN, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Keep him moving. I'm on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MATER - He turns a corner, sees a flower shop. 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, new lady friend? You like flowers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TRACK - McQueen, hearing this, is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MATER - Slowing at the flower shop.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLEY, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: No! Don't go 'in' anywhere. Just keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay outside. Gotcha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen drifts outside allowing Francesco to slip past!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grazie and arrivaderci!

dialogues.speaker: DARRELL CARTRIP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I cannot believe what I just saw, Brent. That was a bonehead move. You don't open up the inside like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE BACK ALLEYS - As Mater moves on he's followed by Pacers and Gremlins. Suddenly ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- CABLES whip in front of them, pulling over flower ven machines and sending the shop's owners into a frenzy. The direct their attention to the AMCs, who try and explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON FINN, admiring his handiwork as he appears. Just as he turns to leave he's BROADSIDED and pushed INTO A DARK ALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE ALLEY - Finn finds himself boxed by two Pacers and pushed toward ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- ACER, who now holds a FLAME THROWER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time I'm gonna make sure you stay dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the flame. WHOOOSSSH!! 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON ANOTHER STREET - Mater clicks along, still looking for Holley. Just as he passes the alley entrance where Finn stares down death:

dialogues.speaker: HOLLEY, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: You're doing brilliantly. Now just stay focused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? You want me to head toward that ruckus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater turns INTO the alley.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLEY, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: No! Don't go down that street!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE ALLEY - Finn, now nearly pushed completely into th flame thrower, leaps into the air. He FIGHTS BACK, using wheels, axle, indeed his entire car frame as if he were human, kicking and tossing and shooting his enemies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater witnesses the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! A live karate demonstration!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TRACK - McQueen, now playing catch-up again, scowl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Mater. Just sign off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE BACK ALLEY - Finn polishes off the AMCs by firing bullet into a gas main line, causing an EXPLOSION that to Acer through the air where he lands in a NOODLE SHOP'S SI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TRACK - The end of the race is nigh ---

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They're bumper to bumper as they approach the finish line!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Formula car gets there first.

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Francesco's the winner, McQueen's number two!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE ALLEY - Finn heaves breaths, surveys his damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was cool! Hey, can I get your autograph? 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater approaches when a MASS OF RACE FANS burst out a doo momentarily blocking Mater's view of Finn. Once the fans past, Finn has disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where'd he go?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLEY, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Our rendezvous has been jeopardized. Keep the device safe. We'll be in touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dadgum, did I miss our date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Post race press conference. Francesco is center stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francesco, over here! Hey, what was your strategy today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strategia? Francesco needs no strategy, it's very simple. You start the race, wait for Lightning McQueen to choke, pass him, then win. Francesco always wins. It's boring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen, waiting in the wings, rolls his eyes. He suddenl notices something O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen's P.O.V. - It's MATER, appearing from a side stre moving toward the pits, oblivious of the press conference

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta tell you, dude. You were in trouble for awhile. That dirt track section had you crawling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
