dialogues.text: As McQueen SNEAKS AWAY ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To truly crush one's dream, you must first raise their hopes very high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN MCQUEEN'S PIT GARAGE - Mater looks around for everyone McQueen approaches. 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey McQueen! What happened? Is the race over? You won, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, why were you yelling things at me while I was racing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yelling? Oh, you thought... that's funny right there. Nah, see that's `cause I seen these two fellers doing some sort of karate street performance. It was nutso. One of them even had a flamethrower ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flamethrower? What are you talking about? I don't understand. Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going to meet my date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She started talking to me as a voice in my head, telling me where to go ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute -- I didn't screw you up, did I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost the race because of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sorry. I didn't mean ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An imaginary girlfriend, flamethrowers. This is exactly why I don't bring you along to these things. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if I, I don't know, talked to somebody and explained what happened I could help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need your help. I don't want your help.

dialogues.speaker: PRESS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, there he is!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The press finds McQueen, swarms him. Mater is pushed backwards as the questions fly again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - McQueen, you had it in the bag! - Yeah, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made a mistake. But I can assure you, it won't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Mater. He takes this badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, guys. We know what the problem is and we've taken care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVER FOOTAGE OF FRANCESCO and various other highlights:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightning McQueen loses in the last lap to Francesco Bernoulli in the first race of the World Grand Prix and three, count em, three cars flamed out leading some to suggest that their fuel, Allinol, might be to blame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOOTAGE OF MILES AXLEROD, speaking to an aggressive press must SHOUT over the press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allinol is safe! Alternative fuel is safe! There is no way my fuel caused these cars to flame out! 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE TV STUDIO - Darrell, Brent and David talk to camer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well the jury may still be out on whether Allinol caused these accidents, but one thing's for sure: Lightning McQueen blew this race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off a FROZEN IMAGE of McQueen crossing the finish line, a look of severe consternation across his face ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Team McQueen can't be happy right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- McQueen's SMILING FACE, on a Team McQueen poster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE to reveal Mater looking at it, sadly. He drives o passing (but not noticing) ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- GREM and ACER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THE SECURITY CHECK - MOMENTS LATER. Cars take off thei tires, move through the metal detector. Mater waits in li A SECURITY CAR approaches Mater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese and English) Come with me please, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm gonna miss my plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE ADMIRAL'S LOUNGE - MOMENTS LATER. The Security Car leads Mater inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they move past us the Security Car covertly drops a BA BEARING which rolls into a corner. The ball bearing then sprouts MECHANICAL LEGS, tripods itself and IRISES out, revealing itself to be a tiny CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater follows the Security Car in, nervous. 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doggone it. This is about my hook, isn't it? I know I should've checked it, but I can't really, look -- it's attached to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZWAPPPPPP!! The Security Car suddenly DECLOAKS himself, reveals himself to be Finn McMissile!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I know you. You're that feller from the karate demonstration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never properly introduced myself. Finn McMissile. British Intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tow Mater. Average intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you with? FBI, CIA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say I'm triple-A affiliated. You know, I know some karate. I don't wanna brag or nothing, but I've got me a black fan belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEEP! Finn's rearview alarms. His camera has picked up Gr and Acer. They've just entered the lounge, are right arou the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you wanna see some moves I made up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're being followed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn quickly turns, fires a tiny GLASS CUTTING BEETLE at window. As Mater talks, oblivious, the beetle cuts out a round hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This first one I can reach into a car's hood, pull out his battery, and show it to him before he stalls. I call it, "What I accidentally did to my friend Luigi once." 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater does his best (worst) karate moves as Acer and Grem turn the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glass drops away, leaving a car-sized hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes the clock) Look, I probably ought to go. I'm about to miss my flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn HOOKS Mater from behind. He YANKS HIM forward ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've taken care of that. Hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- and LEAPS OUT THE WINDOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn pulls Mater down HARD onto the tarmac, towing him aw from the terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is First Class service. You don't even have to go through the terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACER and GREM appear, chasing them. Mater, who is facing backward as he is being pulled along, faces them. They're about a hundred yards back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your karate partners are back here. They kinda look like they're trying to catch up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive forward. Whatever you do, don't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn SKIDS around, whipping Mater in a 180 so that Mater now towing Finn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grem produces a ROCKET, lines up Finn as his target. 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn, without hesitation, fires a MINI ROLLING-JACK. The DRIVES ITSELF toward Grem, anchors itself under his frame flips him like a turtle but not before Grem gets the rock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE ROCKET - it flies toward Mater and Finn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FINN aims and launches a MISSILE back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (only hearing this) Is everything okay back there?

dialogues.speaker: SIDDELEY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Finn, it's Sid. I'm on approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GULFSTREAM JET wings into view overhead. This is SIDDEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater looks up: ACER screeches into view up ahead, draggi long row of luggage carts in Mater's path, attempting to create an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember that whole thing about me not stopping no matter what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as it looks dire --- RATATATATATATAT!!! SIDDELEY descends, hawklike, fires bullets and blows the luggage c sky-high. Mater and Finn burst through them, luggage now raining down from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I should've done carry-on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, old boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siddeley LANDS HARD on the tarmac ahead of them. No time stop, he DROPS his back open, revealing HOLLEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, doggone it. It's my imaginary girlfriend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Get in here! 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater SPEEDS UP toward Siddeley's ramp, Holley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy I tell you what, you really do want this first date, don't ya? That's a no-quit attitude right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Mater's wheels touch the ramp, BULLETS PING aroun him in a spray. Siddeley is HIT, a tire BLOWN. He yells i pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, Sid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siddeley peels off the runway onto the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gunfight ensues between Finn and Acer. Finn SHOOTS ACER TIRE, blowing it and throwing him off-course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acer CAREENS out of control, drives up and THROUGH A JET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- OUT THE OTHER SIDE where he lands in an oil tanker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SIDDELEY - He's headed toward the edge of the tarmac, where the grass and runway meet WATER. He HITS THE GAS, h only hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn, it's now or never!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn BRAKES, 180s and grabs the ramp just as Siddeley get air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, the only thing not in the jet, dangles and recedes from our view as Siddeley climbs toward the clouds. As he PULLED in through the back hatch:

dialogues.speaker: MATER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: By the time you read this, I will be safely on an airplane, flying home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a handwritten (er, tire-written?) NOTE in childi scrawl. We don't see all of it, only a bit. Mater's voice O.S. begins the note with the first sentence, but we DISS into McQueen's voice. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I'm so sorry for what I did. I don't want to be the cause of you losing any more races. I want you to go prove to the world what I already know - that you are the greatest race car in the whole wide world. Your best friend, Mater."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't really want him to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, there's more here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "P.S. Please tell the hotel I didn't mean to order that movie. I thought it was just a preview and I didn't realize I was paying for it. P.P.S... That's funny right there --

dialogues.speaker: PP."
dialogues.text: (to the others) There's a few more pages of P.S.'s here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least I know if he's at home he'll be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIDDELEY breaks through some cloud cover, flies with purp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A well-appointed spy jet. Various computers line the wall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's how I like to start the day! You never feel more alive than when you're almost dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope that device didn't fall off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the closest I ever been to missing my flight! That was --- 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a ROBOTIC ARM, Holley grabs the THE DEVICE that Rod Redline hid under Mater. She yanks it out with a GOOSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still in one piece, great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley drops the device into a mainframe computer. It sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go to a doctor. I keep getting these sharp pains in my undercarriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downloading the photo now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, lemme introduce you two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This here is Finn McSomething-or- other. He's a First Class VIP airport whatchamacallit. And Finn, this here's my date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never did get your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, sorry. It's Shiftwell. Holley Shiftwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Shiftwell. Holley ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DING! The computer is done analyzing. The cabin lights di

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally. Time to see who's behind all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN IMAGE is blasted between the three of them. It's of a photograph, a complicated melange of metallic parts stuck together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mater, expectantly) What is this? 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's one of the worst engines ever made. It's an old aluminum V8 with a Lucas electrical system and Whitworth bolts. Shoot, them Whitworth bolts is a pain, tell you what. Them ain't metric, they ain't inches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, OK, right. But who's engine is this, Mater?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's kinda hard to tell from this picture, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're the one who took it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right. Yes, of course. "A good agent gets what he can, then gets out before he's killed." Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent? You mean like insurance agent, like,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Like a good neighbor, Mater is there'? Wait, you mean secret agents. You guys is spies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley, in how many makes and models did this type of engine appear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley has these stats in seconds. Kid's play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was standard in seven models over a 12-year period. At least 35,000 cars were made with this engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater MOVES HIS SEAT FORWARD, through one part of the hologram so he's face-to-face with Holley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pretty. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, alright. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just pay attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves the engine photo so it's now blocking Mater aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This seems like a dead end. If there were something in the photo that could narrow this down a bit I'd be a lot happier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might not be happy, but I bet this feller is. See how he's had most of his parts replaced? And see all them boxes over there? Them's all original parts. They ain't easy to come by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rare parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's something we can track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley drops her screen down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, Mater! I would never have seen that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know of a black-market parts dealer in Paris, a treacherous lowlife. But, he's the only car in the world who can tell us whose engine this is. Mater, what would you say to setting up an informal task force on this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, what? 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You obviously have plenty of experience in the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well yeah I live right next to one. (thinks about it) I don't know, Finn. I ain't exactly been much help to anybody recently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're helping me. Please, Mater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, okay. But you know I'm just a tow truck, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. And I'm just in the import/export business. Siddeley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Finn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris. Tout de suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, two of them sweets for me too, Sid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I always wanted to be a spy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afterburners, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any other way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siddeley HITS THE JUICE, they kick forward like a mule as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MONTAGE OF PARIS: Mater attempts to merge into roundabo traffic; mimes annoy tourists at the Eiffel Tower; a pain works his magic on an unattractive couple; a couple kisse the most romantic spot in the world; we might even catch GASTOW'S RESTAURANT. 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The charming, low-key introduction ends with a SWEEPING V of Paris's center from far away as we CRANE DOWN INTO ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- a dirty street in the 1st Arrondissement. Finn and Ho drive along together as Mater, playing "spy," darts back forth behind them from doorway to dumpster, "hiding out." He's having a ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once we're inside, stay close. Don't bother checking VIN numbers for criminal records, they're all dodgy here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No VIN scans. Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk to anyone. Don't look at anyone. And absolutely, positively no idling. Are we clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, right. No idling. Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Finn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not here to go shopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Finn and Holley and Mater turn the corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shopping? What do you mean? Why would I ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater turns the corner and enters a massive Les Halles- inspired Parisian market filled with car parts. A tow tru dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dadgum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Parts for sale, Monsieur! - Monsieur! Parts for sale! 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater rolls along, impressed by the goods for sale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me - they've got everything here. Look at them hoods! I could use a hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater continues on though, heeding Finn's advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry fellers, I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, now out of sight of Finn and Holley, passes a dark stall. He STOPS, peers in. There's someone in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. What are you selling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It suddenly OPENS its headlights revealing... EYES!! In French, the mutant car pitches his wares to Mater. Mater FREAKS OUT, speeds off, TERRIFIED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few car lengths ahead of Mater. They roll along, lookin for... Aha! Finn and Holley recede into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In FINN'S SIDE MIRROR: TOMBER, a three-wheeled parts deal argues with a French customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater suddenly turns the corner, sees Finn and Holley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, there are some great ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, get back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. Tomber sees Mater, then notices FINN, reflected a hubcap. He BOLTS. Finn and Holley give chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wait for me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomber, skidding away, kicks a tent in Finn's way. Holley quickly pivots RIGHT and disappears. Where did she go? 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn, hot in pursuit, leaps another obstacle and loses gr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- Tomber who turns a corner and finds himself grill to grill with HOLLEY. He whips to the left but TURNS OVER, rolling sideways and CRASHING to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley ZAPS him with ELECTROSHOCKERS. Finn suddenly arriv stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you lost your mind?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater! This chap needs a tow. Hook him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOMENTS LATER - Mater tows Tomber, following Finn and Hol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You rusty piece of junk, get your dirty hook off me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn throws open a door. Cars scatter like cockroaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the cars) Allez! Maintenant - vite!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater unhooks an angry Tomber who spits in French. Finn p the door down. As it LATCHES TIGHT ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electroshock! Are you kidding me??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Tomber. This is her first field assignment - she didn't know you were my informant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Informant? 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rookie, eh? I never liked new car- smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley FUMES with anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomber was doing 20 to life in a Moroccan impound the first time I saved him, if I recall correctly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of recalls, you're getting up there in mileage aren't you, Finn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, we get it. You both know each other, you're both old. So.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley shoots a HOLOGRAPHIC PHOTO of the engine in front Tomber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go, informant. Inform us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomber eyes the photo. He recoils, unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the worst motor ever made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Tomber narrows his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. That oil filter... those wheel bearings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do those parts look familiar, Tomber?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They should. I sold them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To whom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea. He's my best customer, but he always does his business over the phone. I was always wondering why he needs so many parts. Now I know. 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, a lemon needs parts. Ain't nothing truer than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Lemon?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know. Cars that don't ever work right. Lemons is a tow truck's bread and butter. Like them Gremlins and Pacers we run into at the party and the race and the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley, pull up the pictures from the oil platform. I want to know what other type of cars were out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley complies and suddenly PHOTOS OF CARS FROM THE OIL PLATFORM hang suspended in the air in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Let's see. There were Hugos. And Trunkovs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, are these cars considered lemons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the Popemobile Catholic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn. Everyone involved in this plot is one of history's biggest loser cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley refers to the ENGINE PHOTO, which now rises forwar the prominent picture, perhaps the only one in view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they're all taking their orders from the car behind this engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This explains it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, Tomber? 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gremlin, Pacer, Hugo and Trunkovs never get together. But they're having a secret meeting in two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's this meeting taking place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Porto Corsa, Italy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where the next race is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there's a good chance our mystery engine will be there too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your chances are more than good. I just sent him a new clutch assembly yesterday... to Porto Corsa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley, contact Stephenson and have him meet us at Gare de Lyon. Good work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHENSON, a THREE-CAR LUXURY BULLET TRAIN speeds along snow-covered mountain in the dead of night, its halogen headlight cutting through the darkness. It DIPS into a

dialogues.speaker: MATER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Boy, I'll tell you what. That three- wheeled feller had to be right about a big meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, Finn and Holley scroll through surveillance-style photos of TRAFFIC on an Italian street. They're in the fr train car, which doubles as a luxury seating area and intelligence command center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never see this many lemons in one town. Unless there's a swap meet, or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how'd you get all them pictures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I remotely reprogrammed Porto Corsa's red light cameras to do recognition scans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, not only is you the prettiest car I ever met, but you the smartest too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a familiar sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater refers to a photo of VICTOR HUGO, the HUGO Lemonhea being towed by an EASTERN EUROPEAN TOW TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Hugo being towed. But he looks absolutely perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. They must be the heads of the lemon families.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes sense. If I was rich and broke down every day, I'd hire me to tow me around all the time too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to infiltrate that meeting. It's the only way to find out who's behind all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley SNAPS Mater's picture, temporarily blinding him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh! 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley turns back to her monitor. Mater's face appears on screen. She quickly GRAFTS it over the Hugo's tow truck's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good job, Miss Shiftwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley isn't sure what surprises her more: the compliment how pleased it makes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Finn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, I sure wish my friends could see me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quaint Italian piazza. A pristine MASERATI FOUNTAIN, complete with ancient trident, looms in our view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luigi and Guido roll into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guido, your eyes do not deceive you. We are in Italy. We are home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge, Fillmore and McQueen exit a WGP transport truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Luigi. Which way to the hotel, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No friends of mine will stay in a hotel in my village. You will stay with my --- Uncle Topolino!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNCLE TOPOLINO, a distinguished 1937 Fiat Topolino, rolls forward. He greets them warmly with affectionate Italian salutations as word of Guido and Luigi's arrival spreads. square FILLS with family and friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A festive homecoming party. Lights strung across the squa Music and dancing. Fillmore and Sarge are at a dining tab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do they do it? These are the same ingredients as back home, but it tastes so good. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's organic, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree hugger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING MCQUEEN rolls along the periphery of the square seems lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE TOPOLINO, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Race car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Topolino beckons McQueen over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look so down, so low. Is like you have flat tires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAMA TOPOLINO, a hefty Italian grandmother pipes up, a mi minute then drives off, now a car on a mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said you look like you're starving. That she's going to make you a big meal, and fatten you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mama Topolino, please. You don't need to make a fuss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. She's disappeared inside her kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capisco. I understand. Is a problem, yes? Between you and a friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wise car hears one word and understands two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen takes this in, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, and Luigi told me. While Mama cooks, come and take a stroll with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They amble forward, Uncle Topolino setting the pace. 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought my friend Mater along on the trip. And I told him he needed to act different, that we weren't in Radiator Springs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Mater. He's a close friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why would you ask him to be someone else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen considers this - a realization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I do? I said some things during our fight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, back when Guido and Luigi used to work for me, they would fight over everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE SQUARE - Guido dances with a girl. Luigi suddenly IN. They begin to ARGUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fight over what Ferrari was the best Ferrari; which one of them look more like a Ferrari... There were even some non-Ferrari fights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guido now LIFTS Luigi, cuts BACK in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I tell them, va bene. It's okay to fight. Everybody fights now and then, especially best friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen takes this in. Seems to take some small comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you gotta make up fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen's comfort quickly evaporates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fight more important than friendship. 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guido and Luigi now dance together with the girl and her friend who has just arrived. All having a great time. The dance past us, crossing in front of MCQUEEN AND UNCLE TOPOLINO. We STAY WITH them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chi trova un'amico, trova un tesoro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever find a friend, find a treasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama Topolino drops a tray of food in front of McQueen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, mangia! Eat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MCQUEEN, distant, taking all of this in, lost in thoug as, in the background, Uncle Topolino and Mama Topolino t then argue, then make up (all in Italian) all while we st on McQueen's pensive face ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephenson glides along, all business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn, one hour to Porto Corsa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Stephenson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn watches as HOLLEY attaches a new EMERGENCY LIGHT on Mater's roof. It looks exactly like his old one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That should just about do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Mater, it's voice-activated. But you know, everything's voice- activated these days. 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I thought you was supposed to be making me a disguise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voice recognized. Disguise Program Initiated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZWWWWAT! A HOLOGRAPHIC disguise suddenly umbrellas out, emitted from Mater's roof. It drops a clean cloaking imag the EASTERN EUROPEAN TOW TRUCK over Mater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool! Hey, computer. Make me a German truck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Request acknowledged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZWATTTT! Mater suddenly wears lederhosen and a German hat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out. I'm wearing Materhosen. Make me a monster truck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Request acknowledged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's transformed into Dracula, complete with fangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I vant to siphon your gas. Now make me a taco truck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Request acknowledged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A funny car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Request acknowledged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn suddenly pushes a button, stops the madness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The idea is to keep a low profile, Mater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, chastened, moves on. 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I just go in, pretend to be this truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And leave the rest to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now hold still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley turns back to her work. The disguise's cloaking is larger than Mater. As a result, Holley must dial it back fit his body. As she carefully calibrates the hologram:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to do the final fitting on your disguise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley STOPS. The 3D disguise is now flush with his frame but dents SHOW THROUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear. That's no good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She deploys A BONDO SPRAYER on a robotic arm, moves it to one of Mater's DENTS. Mater pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The disguise won't calibrate effectively without a smooth surface to graft onto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. For a second there I thought you was trying to fix my dents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then no thank you. I don't get them dents buffed, pulled, filled or painted by nobody. They're way too valuable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dents are valuable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I come by each one of them with my best friend Lightning McQueen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fix these. I want to remember these dents forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you were being serious in Paris? McQueen isn't just part of your cover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friendships can be dangerous in our line of work, Mater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But my line of work is towing and salvage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. And Miss Shiftwell's is designing iPhone apps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I meant for real. I ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Say no more. I'll work around the dent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn hits a button. The walls transform into a MASSIVE WEAPONS CACHE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look a little light on weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Mater's RXN ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- STEPHENSON EMERGES LOUDLY from a tunnel. He powers forward, starts his descent into Italy ---

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You are looking live at beautiful Porto Corsa, Italy, on the Italian Riviera. What a magnificent setting for the second race of the World Grand Prix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over sweeping helicopter BEAUTY SHOTS: 78.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID HOBBSCAP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well Brent, they call this place "The Gem of the Riviera," and it's easy to see why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A local fishing boat chugs through an idyllic waterway, beneath bridges that connect hillside villas.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID HOBBSCAP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: With its secluded beaches and opulent casinos, Porto Corsa truly is a playground for the wealthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long line of RICH-LOOKING YACHTS in the harbor.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID HOBBSCAP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And everyone who's anyone is here today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rich SPORTS CARS drive past pricey shops.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID HOBBSCAP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: From the ultra-rich and super- famous, to world leaders and important dignitaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE POPEMOBILE, visible in a crowd, drives through town.

dialogues.speaker: DARRELL CARTRIP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You aren't kidding, David. You can't do a three-point turn around here without bumping into some celebrity!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELICOPTER SHOT of the Casino.

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Welcome everyone to the second race of the World Grand Prix!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSTANGBURGER, HOBBSCAP and CARTRIP in the control booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big news continues to be Allinol. Sir Miles Axlerod spoke to the press earlier today to answer questions about its safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOOTAGE OF THE PRESS CONFERENCE - Miles Axlerod, at a pod addresses the press throng. He looks a bit exasperated. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An independent panel of scientists has determined that Allinol is completely safe. Okay? Safe! There it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the race will go on, folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACE GRAPHICS show Francesco with 10 points at the top of race standings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the question everyone is asking: Will the real Lightning McQueen show up today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TRACK - As the racers begin to get into position o the grid.

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well, he better. Talk about a home- track advantage. Francesco Bernoulli grew up racing on this course.

dialogues.speaker: ITALIAN TRACK ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Signore e signori, in the pole position, numero uno...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is cheering already, knows who this is.

dialogues.speaker: ITALIAN TRACK ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... Francescoooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Italian crowd roars and chants for their hometown her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the crowd) Bellissima! Thank you for your support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your big mistake, McQueen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen missed this comment. He approaches his grid posit lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: ITALIAN TRACK ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In the secondo position. Numero novantacinque. Lightning McQueen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers (not so thunderous, obviously) from the crowd. McQ doesn't seem to notice. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN MCQUEEN'S PIT - His team exchanges looks, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen? Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're worried about your fuel, man, don't. It's perfectly safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, guys, I just really wish Mater were here.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCO, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Francesco understands, McQueen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francesco parks next to him, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great. Here it comes. What've you got, Francesco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For famous race cars like Francesco and well... you, to be far away from home is not easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you forgot the insulting part of that insult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is no insult. When Francesco is away from home, he misses his mama just like you miss your tow truck amico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, I maybe misjudged you, because that's exactly how I ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, I am at home. And my mama is right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francesco refers to his MAMA who sits in a special box in crowd, cheering him on, blowing him kisses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama! Don't worry, Mama!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen is very sad! I will beat his cry-baby bottom today!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's the insult we were missing. Grazie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOTS of the racers making the first few turns through th city streets. We PAN to the CASINO DI PORTO CORSA. The Be Arts-style architecture towers atop a hill, overlooks the course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of thuggish HUGOS - ugly Eastern European cars - impatiently at the front. A LIMOUSINE-STYLE car carrier r up to the roundabout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An esteemed, elderly GREMLIN rolls past with a group of GREMLIN THUGS who usher him into the casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gremlins. Man, those are some ugly cars. Look like someone stole their trunks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THUGS all SNICKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scusatemi, tutti! Signori!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley arrives, sporting a decent Italian accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mio nonno, my grandfather, has broken down. If one of you would help I would be so thankful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IVAN, AN EASTERN EUROPEAN TOW TRUCK (the one Holley and F prepped Mater to impersonate), drives forward.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN THE TOW TRUCK
dialogues.text: Sounds like you need some "roadside assistance".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was talking to me, Ivan. 82.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN THE TOW TRUCK
dialogues.text: Oh really? Prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, don't fight over me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley directs her interest toward Ivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signore Tow Truck, per favore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATER - He watches this from a safe hiding spot around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: FINN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Get ready, Mater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FINN, at an outdoor cafe on the casino grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on any moment now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATER, now looking a bit nervous. He backs out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about this, Finn. What if I screw things up?

dialogues.speaker: FINN, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Impossible. Just apply the same level of dedication you've been using to play the "idiot tow truck" and you'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that them guys look pretty tough and --- Wait, did you say "idiot"? Is that how you see me?

dialogues.speaker: FINN, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: That's how everyone sees you. Isn't that the idea? I tell you, that's the genius of it. No one realizes they're being fooled because they're too busy laughing at the fool. Brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Finn talks, Mater takes this in. He catches his own reflection in a nearby window. Seems to be seeing himself with new eyes. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZZZZATTT! Mater jumps at the sound, turns in time to see SHOCKED UNCONSCIOUS by Holley's ZAPPERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you in disguise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, there's no time. Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. Computer: disguise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Request acknowledged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, now disguised as Ivan the Tow Truck, approaches th Hugos. Another LIMO CAR CARRIER arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the boss! He is coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The carrier parks and the back opens. VICTOR HUGO waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater realizes Victor is talking to him. He hops to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivan, why do you insult me so by making me wait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, now with Victor hooked, tows him in the front door the casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON FINN - now joined in the cafe by Holley who monitors everything and SEES EVERYTHING MATER SEES on her display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen and Francesco battle for first place ---

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The racers are now making their way around the hairpin, and headed downhill toward the casino bridge. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars play craps with FUZZY DICE; slot machines with odome for jackpot numbers; cigarette girls sell car items.

dialogues.speaker: CIGARETTE GIRL CAR
dialogues.text: Air Freshener, antenna balls, sparkplugs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MATER - He tows VICTOR. They are flanked on all four corners by Hugo thugs, ala a presidential motorcade. The largess of the interior design seems to finally snap Mate out of his funk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, this place looks like it's made out of gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hugos on either side of Mater exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLEY, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: That's because it is, Mater. Now, be careful what you say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is that? What do you mean don't talk to you? (more talking from Holley which we cannot hear) So you want me to stop talking to you. Right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are acting strange today, Ivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea what you're talking about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATER'S P.O.V. - A digital readout isolates the Hugo and starts to scroll reams of information alongside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Alexander Hugo, aka "Chop Shop Alex."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN A WIDER SHOT we realize this display is invisible to a but Mater. Some of Alex's other alias' include "Alexander Don't Go" and "Alexander the Not-So Great." 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you got a lot of aka's, Alex. But I guess that makes sense seeings how you's wanted in France, Germany, the Czech Republic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting in to his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater! Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander Hugo, unaware of Holley's interruption, whisper Mater as they turn a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. Keep your voice down. You're gonna make me arrested. (to the other Hugos) Don't mess with Ivan today. He's in a bad mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley, hearing this, can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater tows Victor inside a private room, where inside are WORLD'S WORST CARS including VLADMIR TRUNKOV, TUBBS PACER J. CURBY GREMLIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Victor!

dialogues.speaker: J. CURBY GREMLIN
dialogues.text: There you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, come in.

dialogues.speaker: J. CURBY GREMLIN
dialogues.text: Victor Hugo. I'm J. Curby Gremlin, from Detroit. It's good to see you. Now we can start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the big boss here yet? 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's supposed to be here any minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! A DOOR is thrown open O.S. Everyone turns, now sile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE DOOR - It sits open. No one enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room of Lemons watch, nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MATER - Nervously watching too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car finally appears. It's Zundapp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guten Tag!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just the Professor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zundapp, when is he coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's already here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONITORS descend from the ceiling. On them, an image of A ENGINE - the same bloody engine from the photo. But this LIVE image. The car is being worked on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VOICE is garbled, scrambled. No way to determine who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could be with you on this very special day but... my clutch assembly broke. You know how it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lemons all nod in understanding. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been there.

dialogues.speaker: J. CURBY GREMLIN
dialogues.text: Forget about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know how you feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Descramble that voice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (already on it) I'm trying... It's too sophisticated!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are here to celebrate. Today all your hard work pays off. The world turned their backs on cars like us. They stopped manufacturing us, stopped making our parts. The only thing they haven't stopped doing is laughing at us. They've called us terrible names...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On VICTOR HUGO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jalopy. Rustbucket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On TUBBS PACER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heap. Clunker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On J. CURBY GREMLIN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junker, beater, wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On ZUNDAPP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rattletrap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And finally back on the monitor. The ENGINE. 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemon. But their insults just give us strength. Because today, my friends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monitors switch to LIVE RACE FOOTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that all ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the VIDEO SCREENS - CARLA VELOSO'S ENGINE BLOWS ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veloso swerves, attempts to mitigate a crash ---

dialogues.speaker: DARRELL CARTRIP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There's smoke! On the casino bridge!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID HOBBSCAP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's Carla Veloso, the Brazilian race car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She skids into a wall, hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What just happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (analyzing the data) I'm working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lemons are CHEERING. Mater is freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laughed at us. But now it's our turn to laugh back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! Another racer blows an engine. Mater JUMPS again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the racer smashes into the railing --- 89.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID HOBBSCAP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Another crash! It's number nine, Nigel Gearsley.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Embrace your inner lemon! Let it drive you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm detecting an extremely strong electromagnetic pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley replays that last crash. The OUTLINE OF THE BEAM i seen hitting the racer. Holley TRACES THIS to its source

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- a WGP CAMERA, which Grem and Acer have pointed at the racers from a tower position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn, it's the camera!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn TAKES OFF, speeding toward Grem and Acer ---

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This was meant to be alternative fuel's greatest moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angry fans knock over cans of Allinol. One drives over an Allinol sign. They're fed up with it.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: After today everyone will race back to gasoline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We RACK FOCUS to reveal another fan as he RIPS an Allinol banner down angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video screens are now filled with ONE IMAGE - of the PLATFORMS in the Pacific from the beginning of the movie. 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we, the owners of the world's largest untapped oil reserve, will become the most powerful cars in the world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn ducks, weaves, speeds, and pushes his way through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the way! Andate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He speeds furiously through town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen and Francesco FLY PAST US.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will come to us and they will have no choice, `cause they will need us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON FINN - He SPEEDS up a road, Grem and Acer visible ahea him. He LEAPS over the crevasse toward the AMC cousins --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, FINN FREEZES. He's immobilized in mid-air!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up. A CHOPPER with a LARGE MAGNET hovers over hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We figured you might stop by.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And they will finally respect us. So hold your hoods high. After today you will never again be ashamed of who you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grem and Acer turn back to the camera. They line up Shu Todoroki, who's a bit further along now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long live Lemons! 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grem ZAPS THE RACER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flames burst from Todoroki. He loses control.

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Number seven is loose! Shu Todoroki!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shu takes down three more cars with him and others follow suit. It's a nightmare pileup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley sees Finn being flown away by the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn.

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Bumper to bumper as they approach the finish line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen NOSES out Francesco for a win, both oblivious to what's just happened.

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: McQueen's the winner, Francesco's second. And they have no idea what happened behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dah! This is impossible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm talking about. Kachow! Hey, where are all the other cars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see the pile-up from an overhead monitor. Sirens bla as a MEDIC CHOPPER flies to the scene of the pile-up. 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILES AXLEROD - LATER. He's near the casino. He's complet surrounded, 360 degrees, by press. He's drowned out by a blizzard of questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Axlerod! Is the final race in London still going to take place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal we are watching this on monitors in t PRIVATE CASINO ROOM with the Lemonheads, Zundapp and Mate

dialogues.speaker: MILES AXLEROD, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: I suppose that... Look, "the show must go on" as they say. But now is not the time to talk about...

dialogues.speaker: J. CURBY GREMLIN
dialogues.text: I can't believe this is really happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh, quiet!

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: And Allinol? Will you require all the racers to still run on Allinol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Miles Axlerod: He's devastated.

dialogues.speaker: MILES AXLEROD, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: I cannot in good conscience continue to risk the lives of any more race cars. The final race will not be run on Allinol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILD WHOOPING CHEERS fill the room. Lemonade corks are popped.

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: There you have it. A clearly devastated Sir Miles Axlerod announcing that he will not require the cars to use Allinol for the final race. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A toast! To the death of Allinol and alternative fuel forever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley is already on the run. Speeding away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater. Abort the mission. They've got Finn. Get out of there. Get out of there right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns a corner and STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her escape is now blocked by the same HUGO THUGS she tric before. Another vehicle appears BEHIND HER, LOOMS.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN THE TOW TRUCK
dialogues.text: How is your grandfather?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lemonheads celebrate, chant "Long live lemons!" Mater scared, turns to leave. He's stopped by ALEXANDER HUGO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this a great party, Ivan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, it's unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not leaving, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, of course I ain't leavin'.

dialogues.speaker: MCQUEEN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm just in shock like everybody...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, sees that McQueen is being interviewed on the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: MCQUEEN, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Crashes are part of racing, I know. But something like that shouldn't ever happen. 94.

dialogues.speaker: DARRELL CARTRIP, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: They're letting you choose your fuel for the final race. Do you have any idea what it's going to be?

dialogues.speaker: MCQUEEN, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Allinol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The excitement suddenly DRAINS from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - What?! - Did he just say Allinol? After today?

dialogues.speaker: MCQUEEN, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: My friend Fillmore says the fuel's safe. That's good enough for me. I didn't stand by a friend of mine recently. I'm not gonna make the same mistake twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Mater. He takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: BRENT MUSTANGBURGER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: So a surprising revelation from Lightning McQueen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zundapp is already on the phone with their Big Boss who, based on his angry O.S. voice, sounds ticked off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zundapp hangs up, turns to the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allinol must be finished for good. McQueen cannot win the last race. Lightning McQueen must be killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater's eyes open wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater backs up, KNOCKING his emergency light against one the monitors. ZZZZZAT! His holographic disguise flickers then quickly SCROLLS THROUGH all of his previous disguise finally revealing rusty old Mater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the American spy! 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thugs DRAW TERRIFYING WEAPONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dadgum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Gatling gun" request acknowledged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIRRRRR! GUNS roll out of Mater on each side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot. I didn't mean ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Request acknowledged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater SPRAYS BULLETS into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lemons and Lemonheads hit the deck and RETURN FIRE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater is THROWN BACKWARD by the force of the guns, back through some double doors and onto a BALCONY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait wait! I didn't mean that kind of shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correction acknowledged. Deploying chute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOM! A PARACHUTE BURSTS out of the back of Mater, he catches air and is YANKED INTO THE SKY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lemonheads watch him float away, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MATER, out of the frying pan but still toasty. He look around, notices:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING MCQUEEN, far away, leaving the press podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater looks down at the harbor, over which he flies. He s a MOTORBOAT. Mater WHIPS his hook down, steals a ride beh the boat TOWARD MCQUEEN. 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aspetti!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorboat isn't happy about this, tries to shake him. Mater is THROWN INTO A "HOTEL" sign, then SMASHES down through a Francesco souvenir stand. As he CRASHES onto th ground hard, we SMASH CUT TO ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- a barricade. Separating the press from the public, ITALIAN SECURITY TRUCKS stand guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme through! Lemme through!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATER barrels around a corner. He's now covered in France memorabilia and palm leaves. The word `HOT' now dangles o him like the world's biggest bling. He looks INSANE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta let me in! I gotta get through to warn McQueen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security eyes one another. This is serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cannot come through here. Back up, signore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into a walkie-talkie) We have a lunatic at Gate Nove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, listen! I was disguised as a tow truck to infiltrate this Lemonhead meeting and my weapons system misinterperated what I was

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I repeat. Lunatic at Gate Nove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater spots McQueen far off in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen! McQueen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUST OFF THE PRESS STAGE - McQueen is led toward the exit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right this way, signore. 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen looks up but can only see A SEA OF VEHICLES, flashbulbs, cameras, TV trucks with those tall satellite antennae things that spindle toward the sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK AT THE SECURITY BARRICADE - Mater, like a nimble run back, dances around to avoid capture by security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back up, sir. Stop moving! Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater head fakes them and pushes through, into the crowd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oy! Stop! Ferma li!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE CROWD - Mater shoves his way through. He's still f in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That really sounded like Mater. Mater?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MATER, getting CLOSER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen, they're gonna kill you!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MCQUEEN - Okay, he's positive that was his friend, but where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen spots a TOW HOOK, moving through the crowd toward him, "Jaws"-like. 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen disappears into the press crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, where are you going? Please, Mr. McQueen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen pushes through the press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scusi. Mater! Scusi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen tracks the tow hook, gets closer. He pushes throu the last few vehicles ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, I'm so glad to see you. I'm so sorr ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's NOT MATER. It's IVAN, the Hugo Thug's tow truck.

dialogues.speaker: IVAN THE TOW TRUCK
dialogues.text: Lightning McQueen! I am a huge fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry. I thought I heard---

dialogues.speaker: IVAN THE TOW TRUCK
dialogues.text: Yes, but that was me. I said, "You killed out there today." You're the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Oh. I mean, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right this way, signore ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the Press Liaison and his assistants are pushing McQu back in the other direction ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he's pulled away) I really thought I heard my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he's pulled away, press and onlookers start to come between him and Ivan, who hasn't moved. 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In England you'll be finished. At the finish line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivan is now obscured again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ITALIAN PRESS being to swarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, the world press is waiting. You come with me, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen is pulled back ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- just as Mater, now BOUND and with HIS MOUTH TAPED, is pulled away and thrown into the back of a transport vehic He lands hard on his side, spits out his TAPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You actually care about that race car. A pity you didn't warn him in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the doors close on Mater --- PHHHHHSSSSSSTTTTTTT! A thick, noxious gas starts to fill the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On MATER as the knockout gas works its magic. HIS EYES CL

dialogues.speaker: MATER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Idiot? Is that how you see me?

dialogues.speaker: FINN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That's how everyone sees you. I tell you, that's the genius of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE IN on Mater, back at the Casino, eyeing his reflecti in the glass window. It's the same moment from before exc now we are watching it from a DETACHED, FLOATING PERSPECT 100.

dialogues.speaker: FINN, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: No one realizes they're being fooled because they're too busy laughing at the fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - IN THE KABUKI THEATER IN JAPAN - Again, from before. Ma makes a spectacle of himself, WHOOPING AND HOLLERING in t stands with the face paint on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domo arigato!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McQueen, Fillmore, Guido, Luigi, Sarge and patrons eye Ma embarrassed and angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - IN THE JAPANESE MUSEUM - The moment of Mater banging on Zen rock garden's glass. Except that now we see all sorts disappointed and eyebrow raising reactions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You done good! You got all the leaves!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check out that tow truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder who that guy's with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you guys excuse me just for one little second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now REVEAL that this FLOATING, THIRD PERSON PERSPECTIV MATER. He's INSIDE his past, watching it from others' poi of view. He doesn't like what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - ON MATER, now at the sushi bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's a scoop of ice cream!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater swallows the wasabi with one big bite. He SCREAMS! sushi bar patrons blanch with revulsion at his wail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - ON THE FOUNTAIN, as Mater peels into full view of every else at the party. As Mater laps up water from a fountain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater?! 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL THE RACERS, with FRANCESCO front and center, guffaw a Mater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - On MCQUEEN, now scolding Mater moments later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never leak oil. Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, you have to get a hold of yourself. You're making a scene!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - IN MCQUEEN'S PIT GARAGE, after the Japanese race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. I didn't screw you up, did I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost the race because of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if I talked to somebody, or---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need your help. I don't want your help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Now BACK AT THE PARTY, a moment we didn't see before bu which presumably happened. Mater is BANGING a ceremonial GONG, to the horror of Japanese guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bang a gong, get it on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the PARTYGOERS, RACE CARS, PARTY STAFF - they're all laughing at Mater as McQueen's final words blend in, maki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, this isn't Radiator Springs. This is exactly why I don't bring you along to these things!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the GONG at the party ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- to the GONG of a CLOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MATER as he OPENS HIS EYES. 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All around him, all he sees are GIANT PIECES OF MECHANIZE CLOCKWORK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLLEY and FINN are here too, strapped bumper to bumper i the divots of large clock movements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holley! Finn! Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in London, Mater. Inside Big Bentley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BIG HAND finishes ADVANCING one minute. It's 3 PM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Mater DROPS QUICKLY down toward ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --- whirring, scary machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woaaaah! ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAP! The chain yanks to a STOP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mater, instead of being 30 feet from death, is now 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn and Holley are only a few clicks closer to being cru themselves. The clock ticks to 3:01.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This... this is all my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a fool, Mater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I am, remember? You said so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did I... Oh. Mater, I was complimenting you on what a good spy you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a spy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This echoes throughout the clock. 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been trying to tell you that the whole time. I really am just a tow truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn and Holley take this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finn, he's not joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right, Finn. I'm a fool. And what's happened to McQueen is `cause I'm such a big one. This is all my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREM and ACER arrive on a lift, roll into view on a catwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, you're up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just in time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Z wanted you to have a front row seat for the death of Lightning McQueen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acer whips a sheet away, revealing the WGP CAMERA, turns toward the clock face.
